name: code-review
description: Classify source code files by quality and adherence to best practices

categories.name: Exemplary
categories.description: Well-structured, clear, follows best practices consistently

categories.name: Solid
categories.description: Functional and readable, minor improvements possible

categories.name: Needs Work
categories.description: Significant issues with clarity, structure, or correctness

top_priorities: Single responsibility - functions and classes do one thing well
Appropriate abstraction level (not over- or under-engineered)

must_have: No obvious bugs or logic errors
highly_valued: Clean control flow without deep nesting
Proper use of language idioms and standard library
bonus_points: Well-chosen abstractions that simplify the codebase
Clear separation of pure logic from side effects

deal_breakers: Security vulnerabilities (SQL injection, XSS, command injection)
Race conditions or unsafe concurrent access
negative_factors: God functions or classes doing too many things
Copy-pasted code that should be abstracted

specific_guidance: Judge code by how easy it is for a new team member to understand.
Prefer simple, boring code over clever code -- unless cleverness is clearly justified.
A file can be Exemplary even if it's short and simple, as long as it's done well.
Over-engineering (unnecessary abstractions, premature optimization) is a negative factor, not a positive one.
philosophy: Good code is code that's easy to read, easy to change, and hard to break.
